website_summaries.verdict: Darkens a room like it's suppose to, but this might be too dark for some consumers.
pros: Offers optimal light-blocking abilities with durable vinyl construction
cons: Some testers commented that the room might be too dark with this shade in place

customer_reviews.title: Don't cut the cord
customer_reviews.text: It's plastic, so it is durable. But it was hard to cut because it's durable plastic. It also isn't clear from the pictures, but you have to cut from both sides so you don't accidentally cut the pull cord unit off like my husband did, not that I'm blaming him, but seriously honey? I gave it 3 stars for mild marital discord. Get it? Discord.
customer_reviews.author: chrissyhowe

customer_reviews.title: Great blackout shades
customer_reviews.text: The blinds were as described by the seller and worked perfectly. The blinds arrived a couple days before the estimated delivery date. The adhesive seems to be strong enough to hold up the shades. I've only had them installed for a couple weeks now and haven't had any issues with the adhesive. See the attached pictures. The seller also contacted me to make sure I was satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B

customer_reviews.title: This product made my room look like a cave
customer_reviews.text: This product made my room look like a cave. I love it. It's easy to use but the one drawback is that it uses an adhesive strip to attach it to the wall. Though this is convenient for people who are no good with tools, I wonder how long it will remain up. If it comes down though, it can be easily put up again with another adhesive. What a potential buyer must be aware of is that the center of the blinds is totally black but as you get closer to the ends, some light from the outside is visible.
customer_reviews.author: VAUGHN T. STANFORD

customer_reviews.title: Window treatment - NOT FUNCTIONAL BLINDS
customer_reviews.text: I. HATE. These blinds. I did SO MUCH research and finally thought that these would do the trick on the small budget I have. SAVE YOUR MONEY if you ever plan on opening and closing these blinds more than once. Attached is a picture after I opened it and closed it for two of my sons naps and night sleep. Literally one day of use and it’s trashed. Everything was measured and cut correctly (which, by the way, is a hassle in and of itself). They blacked out the room well enough but they do NOT ACT AS FUNCTIONAL BLINDS.
customer_reviews.author: KAPA

customer_reviews.title: Darkness
customer_reviews.text: For the price and simplicity definitely worth it. I also used some mounting tape for extra support just in case. I had to cut just a little of from the side to make it pull up more smoothly. This did make the room more darker and prevented morning light from bleeding through. So far satisfied with this shade and will definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: A. Rod

customer_reviews.title: This blind is absolute crap!
customer_reviews.text: This blind arrived with broken clips which were discovered after cutting to size. It is a pain raise as you have to repleat every pleat. When raised, the clips I had to purchase hang down and the blind looks awful. I only needed it to block a street light at night...ie black out. If you wish to leave it down 100% of the time, great. If you want cheap and ugly, great. If you want broken non replaceable clips which the seller deems not to respond to, great. I needed a 10 5/8" wide blind for a door side window. Had hope this would work. It is awful. I ordered a custom REAL blind to install instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Temporary Window Covering
customer_reviews.text: Although these window coverings are supposed to be temporary, I have some that were installed many years ago and are still hanging and looking good. These are much better than the "Redi Shades" that are available at Lowe's, Home Depot or Bed, Bath & Beyond with the clips. I highly recommend them. Most people will not know that they are "temporary."
customer_reviews.author: East Coast Z

customer_reviews.title: Ruined trim
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on leaving these up forever ignore this review. As the item is called temporary and this is what I needed them for I will review them as such. They worked sufficiently while on however when I removed them my paint went with it. It stripped all the trim paint off the window trim. For a temporary shade to destroy your window trim means 1 star in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Marc H.

customer_reviews.title: Controllable Darkness
customer_reviews.text: We're lucky to have a guest suite for visiting friends. About half of them like it "pitch black" to sleep. Several of these "dark-lovers" complained about our outside security lights at night (I favor the well-lit prison yard motif) which shine through the sheer white curtains. My wife wouldn't agree to "blackout" drapes, so we settled on these as an inexpensive compromise. They are easily installed in seconds with the included self-stick tape. I stuck them at the top of window hidden nicely inside the sheers. Now we can just lower the blinds at night for our dark-loving friends, and leave them up and out of sight for the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Avg User

customer_reviews.title: Do you love origami?!
customer_reviews.text: If you love origami then these blinds are for you! After a couple of days they have no fold memory for you to lift up and clip. Guess you can just fold how you want. A swan, flower, geometric shapes. Just don’t expect them to accordion style fold back up without folding each piece and having an extra 2 or 3 hands!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shades
customer_reviews.text: They are obviously a temp shade, but serve their purpose and actually look quite nice. The drawstring makes them easy to raise up and down, and they do give complete privacy in the room. Also darkening enough to sleep. They were a little harder to cut to size than the directions would have you believe. You are supposed to be able to use a box-knife, and I guess you could, but my husband got frustrated with that and had a big pair of industrial shears in his shop that he used. We are in a new (to us) residence, and these are giving us privacy, and time to figure out what we want for permanent treatments. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda K

customer_reviews.title: Nice item, cheap price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. Easy to install, keeps out the light. Some light still comes through the holes for the draw strings, but not much. I purchased for both of my bedrooms. Installed in less than 10 minutes each. The tape/adhesive on the top is really strong. Easy to cut down to size, I used an exacto knife and a scizzors, turned out perfect. You do have to reach up to the top to open it all the way up or to close it from the all the way open position. You can keep it open to whatever length you want, it has a draw string end to keep it secure.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Privacy
customer_reviews.text: The windows I needed privacy for are 48" x 34, so I was able to use one 48" x 75" shade for two windows. They are super easy to hang, although I had to order some stronger adhesive tape. (I got the reusable two-sided tape, which is good if you need to reposition the shade and also if you need to put some on the bottom to keep it closed.) The privacy level is excellent, unlike the kind with vinyl slats that have spaces you can easily see through. I am very happy with the quality and affordable price of this product.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryAuthor

customer_reviews.title: Durable and functional but hard to remove
customer_reviews.text: I love that these lasted almost 6 months, and they have the lift/lower string function but the adhesive is very hard to remove. There's virtually no way to get it off of matte paint without scraping off the paint, and on semigloss it takes forever with Goo Gone because it comes off in little pieces. I also had Redi Shades in some areas of the house, which were not as functional but the adhesive strip came off in one continuous piece.
customer_reviews.author: B. Elmore

customer_reviews.title: Buy corded, avoid cordless
customer_reviews.text: Buy corded. We broke corded by accident and needed a replacement. Since corded is not available I got cordless. The design is a joke. The corded looks much better and cleaner when its raised up. The cordless shade looks like your grandma suddenly arrived to your house and quickly fixed your broken basement blinds with clips. The clip falls apart easily when it's dropped
customer_reviews.author: Vitas_Shark

customer_reviews.title: Good looking blinds that are easy to install
customer_reviews.text: These lightweight vinyl blinds do a good job of darkening my bedroom and would have been extremely easy to put up if I had read the directions first. I really like the ability to raise and lower the blinds also. I have used paper blackout blinds for years so I hope these last as long as they did. The blinds arrived very quickly and look nice in the bedroom. I'm considering placing them in the window in the living room behind my blackout curtains as added help to combat the humid summer heat. I don't mind living in a 'cave' when it saves money on the electric bill!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ehh.....
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they block out the light. I would suggest using these covers only if you don't ever plan to raise the blinds. They are very difficult to get up and then you have to clip it so it doesn't fall down. Yeah....no. What you are paying for is to keep the light out....that's it. If you want to raise the blind every morning forget it. Spend more money on a REAL blind that actually goes up and down with the pull of a string. These are nonsense, unless you never have to move the blind once you stick it to the wall.
customer_reviews.author: John Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Dark as night. Great Buy.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t believe how easy it was to cut to size and mount in minutes, without my husbands help. Don’t care much for the clips, but we don’t have to raise and lower as it’s in a study. I must say we love the total room darkening as this was a window on the west side of our house. It not only darkens but protects the curtains from hot afternoon sun.. I have to believe it will keep the room much cooler in the hot summer months. One important thing I will say...make sure you place it carefully because the adhesive is so good you won’t be moving it.
customer_reviews.author: john and linda curtis

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to order these blinds bcuz I wasn’t sure how they’d stick on my bathroom window. I’m so happy it worked!!! My bathroom window is extremely large with a non-standard shape. This was the best decision I could’ve made and it ended up being so much cheaper than some of the other options I was considering! Great purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ally R

customer_reviews.title: Block out all light, but you might need to secure them a little better
customer_reviews.text: I do love these. I had two on my windows. They block out all light and my room is completely dark. The main problem with these is the adhesive didn't stick very well. I had to secure them with small nails. The good thing was though that when I moved out, I was able to pull them off without a problem. The window had no damage at all. My other issue was with the clips. If I wanted to let some light in, I'd have to use the clips to make sure the shades would stay up. Most of the time, the clips would come flying off. Eventually I gave up and just used binder clips instead.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Quick Solution to our Baby's Room
customer_reviews.text: Super effective for my 11 month old's bed room. We didn't want to commit to having heavy drapes in his room, so we bought these adhesive black out shades. We were able to install behind our wood blinds, so when they are pulled up, you don't even see them. If you have kids, the string is in the middle so it is a bit challenging to store the cord up without having it be a choking hazard. I would prefer the cord on the side, but I understand why they are built they way they are, since they can be cut. We cut ours with a kitchen knife (Cutco serrated edge) and they came out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: For simple stick on shades these are really nice! The vinyl holds up better than similar paper ...
customer_reviews.text: For simple stick on shades these are really nice! The vinyl holds up better than similar paper ones I've purchased in the past and they were very easy to install! I had to cut two to size in a window and it wasn't hard at all to trim a little off the sides with just standard house hold scissors. The draw sting makes it really easy to raise and lower the shades. They aren't black out, but definitely darken the room well. I'm really happy with this purchase and would recommend these shades!
customer_reviews.author: Xxxxxx

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed they don't stay up at all. I had them full length on and tried putting them up with the clips that came with it so i can have light in the morning. That didn't work. So i just covered them up there but in the middle of night they fell. It scared the hell out of me as i was asleep. Tore them off right that morning. They do block the light though. So if someone who has literally an extremely small window it might be good for them. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hira Naqvi

customer_reviews.title: clips are cheap
customer_reviews.text: i got these so I can have privacy while i work at night but prefer them open during the day and so every morning i struggle for 5 minutes to fool with and put together the cheap clips. I finally just dug out large binder clips from my desk to use ;(. these are temporary while I order new shades for my office but still though the clips would work better than they did. they fell apart every day so far including the day 1st day I went to use them. They are not broken so I can put them back together but still a bit to much work.
customer_reviews.author: Remona F.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to block afternoon sun
customer_reviews.text: Added these to cover a couple leaded glass windows next to and on or front door. Afternoon sun was wreaking havoc in my front room making it hard to be in it in the afternoons. Bought I set and cut then into 2 that were the right widths using a serrated knife. Cleaned the areas where they would stick and installed (peeled the tape and stuck them up) and they did the trick. That room stays dark now and can be enjoyed anytime, day or night.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Axworthy

customer_reviews.title: Blocks the sun and that's the ONLY good thing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blind to stop the early morning sun from shining in our east facing porch door window. It does stop the sun. Cutting and install was not a big deal. What is a big deal and the reason I don't recommend it. RAISING/FOLDING it up is a a real hassle. Due to the fact that the vinyl is so thin and flimsy. And the included clips need to grip tighter to hold it in the raised position. Would I buy it again? ABSOLUTELY NOT! Is it doing the job.... Yes. If I had to fight to raise it more than once a day, I would rip it off and throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Zman

customer_reviews.title: Whatever you do don’t try to open these.
customer_reviews.text: These blinds lurk in the depths of hell waiting for a chance to sneak out through the Amazon ether and cause you mass frustration. Folding them up takes 3 hands as one side flops around and unfolds when you try to put the clip on. Oh and if you want to use these to Block light you might as well tape toilet paper to your window because it would do a better job. The only reason you should buy these is if your not going to open them and you want privacy but don’t mind a lot of light coming in.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t Come With Clips
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to install and do a great job of darkening a room even further behind room darkening curtains. However, if we ever want to let light in or open a window, it’s next to impossible! Thought it would come with clips to keep it up based on the picture but it didn’t. And any clips we do try to use pop off. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Yi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for the windows in my basement. They were extremely easy to put up and install. They work great and definitely do the trick. I will say however, the blinds and the blind material is definitely a bit chintzy and seems some what cheap. The little plastic clips they give you to hold the blinds up are incredibly cheap and can be very easily broken. With that said, they definitely worked for what I needed them for, and at a relatively inexpensive price I am happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Super Easy to put up!
customer_reviews.text: Very professional looking! If you measure correctly you too can have a finished look to your windows. With a common box cutter or swiss army knife you can cut cleanly through to fit your window frame. Adhesive issues are RELATIVE! If you have a dirty window enclosure think logically. Clean it before installing. For those who have nonporous surfaces clean with some isopropyl. I have installed my onto a wood frame. It works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieCee

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! So easy to use and keeps the light out.
customer_reviews.text: These have worked so well. I’ve had paper/cardboard type ones before; these are much better, almost like a plastic or vinyl type situation. No light gets through these! My husband and I keep them closed on the weekend when we want to sleep later without the sunrise waking us, then open them throughout the week on workdays. I love that they’re small enough to tuck behind out regular blinds so they’re out of sight. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: HillcatHolly

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Just what was need for the man cave! Excellent price and worth every penny as it blocks the light. Hubby couldn't be more pleased as he was about to spend $40 per window for roller blackout blinds before I came across these. I scored major points on this purchase! Great value, easy to install and look great! Very very happy with this purchase :) I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Honesty

customer_reviews.title: Clips makes dents in the vinyl, doesn’t stay up on its own
customer_reviews.text: This is good for windows that you don’t need the shade up all the time and don’t use frequently. The clips to hold the shade up make dents in the vinyl so keep that in mind. You can lift up the shade easily with your hands but it doesn’t stay up without the clips. Otherwise, this is a good alternative to the expensive shades for windows. Looks nice and clean, easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: akohana

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought another brand but when they boosted the price up a significant amount, I decided to look elsewhere. That was a mistake. This was folded in half in the box so it was broken when I got it. Additionally, the adhesive is not nearly as strong as the others I've purchased that are still hanging on by their original adhesive over a year later. That may be because it was bent and won't lay flush against the window - who knows. Either way, I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn Whichard

customer_reviews.title: Great blinds
customer_reviews.text: These are a wonderful short term (or even long term) solution to window coverings. We moved in 3 years ago and still haven't gotten around to buying blinds, so these are wonderful. They were easy to install, probably took all of 15 minutes, and they're easy to use as well. I bought the white ones as we have light gray curtains and they do a great job of blocking light. We've been using them for several months and I don't plan on replacing them until they break because I'm lazy.
customer_reviews.author: Familyof6

customer_reviews.title: These are not white
customer_reviews.text: I would have given these a 5⭐️ Rating however because these are not white I took a star off. I like the way they look, they were easy to install, easy to clip up, easy to cut, they seem like they would hold up a good while as well. In my opinion, for this price you can’t beat it but I would have liked them even more if they were actually white and not a light gray color.
customer_reviews.author: Eribee83

customer_reviews.title: Recommend 100%!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you have cats like me who have destroyed all of your blinds then these are the answer! I ordered 3 to start just to make sure they worked and then I just ordered 6 more for the rest of my home! I was surprised at how much more light they block than your average blind. There’s no strings or cords for my cat to try to attack. Super easy to put up! I didn’t have to worry about cutting mine to size bc the size I ordered was the exact size I needed for my windows. The quality was better than I expected for the price of these. I recommend !!
customer_reviews.author: MANDY

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I hoped I'd find but didn't think I would!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a shad that I could raise up and down for my office window. I don't have the ability to put screws in the wall but worried that the tape wouldn't stick well on this. This is incredible. The tape does its job and them some. I don't know what it will do to the painted surface when it is time to remove it but right now I dont care. It looks high quality, does what I need it to and love that it took less than a minute to install. I had to cut it but I just used a heavy duty scissors and it was easy!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Dorm Black-Out!
customer_reviews.text: Live in apartment/college dorm so I have moved around a lot. Used paper shades in the past and none of them fit my window right and still let light in (even though they were black-out). This covers all of my window and looks way better than my paper shade ever did! I was able to easily cut it down the inch or so it needed to perfectly fit my window. I love the fact that they have a string to open/close them, it's must easier and faster than using "clips". Adhesive top is also super sticky and I have no concerns with it coming down without me taking it down.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Very Flimsy clips for Cordless Shade
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the corded shade but was sent the cordless shade which I decided to keep instead of dealing with the hassle of returning. Don’t wast your money on the cordless shade. It comes with two very flimsy clear clips that you have to move every time you want to adjust the shade. I have had mine up for 5 days and on of the clips has already broken, the shade weight is too heavy for the plastic clips. I have several of the corded shades and they are far more convent to raise and lower.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendolyn Vestraci

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased one set of these blinds and cut them in half horizontally to put on two small windows (and used my own adhesive tape for one side) They are mostly light blocking in the color white, which is fine for me I did not need complete darkness, just to shield the sun entering. Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy install
customer_reviews.text: I am a night shift nurse and was looking to darken our room. My wife wanted something that is not permanent since we sometimes want to brighten our room and get the sunshine in. Tinted windows is another option but will take time to install and it will be permanent. Since we found this, it made our decision easier. My picture tells it all. Window on left has shade, window on far right has none.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made crappy shades
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the positive reviews. I cut them (two inches) on one side to make them fit my window not realizing that the draw string is in the middle of the shade. That slight imbalance has made them impossible to raise without seriously bunching up. I can also raise them halfway before it can't get any further because of the bunching. The look awful bunched as they protrude outward. They're also falling apart after 6 months. These will soon be in a garbage when I have the time to replace!
customer_reviews.author: Touchdown Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash.
customer_reviews.text: These are TRASH! I hate that my husband tried to surprise me and hung them with out me looking at them. No way to get our money back now. They do not go up at all, they have to be clipped up. They are very thin material, and the sticky part is cheap. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: hambone

customer_reviews.title: OK if you plan to leave down
customer_reviews.text: These are fine if you plan to leave them down. If you want to have them up during the day they are EXTREMELY hard to fold back up. Once the vinyl gets stretched out it doesn’t want to fold back up. The clips do work well- IF you can get the things back into the folded position. The paper ones I have had are much better and even a little more room darkening. I bought the white ones.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: A little inconvenient
customer_reviews.text: The price and quality overall are great! If you’re anything like me and want something that is hassle free and you have shutters this might not be for you. Too many steps for me I have to open the shutters and make sure that they hold up properly, then click each side then close my shutters again. I have to repeat those steps in between each nap if I don’t want it so dark in the room for my baby. It’s more of a personal preference. The product is great though! I almost forgot to mention the clips are very cheap and can easily be broken so that is a little annoying having to fix them every time
customer_reviews.author: Laura Gideon

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, easy install and very pretty.
customer_reviews.text: I Love this blind ! I was skeptical when I opened it, but when I hung it , it was so easy, the stick was great ! It looks so much better than the corded ones. I really didn't want a cord beings my puppies are so playful. This is perfect! It comes with 2 little clothespin clips to raise it. I even ordered a second one for my bathroom ! You cut it to the width 😉
customer_reviews.author: AT

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price.  These work!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for something to darken bedroom. This is great! Lightweight but sturdy. Easy to install, just stick where you want. I did not want to cut it, so stuck it to outside window frame right under the curtain rod. No issues. And these work! Bedroom is dark. Great orice, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mackie2u2

customer_reviews.title: Blinds are great, clips not so much
customer_reviews.text: I love these blinds, they’re so easy to install and keep the light out of my toddlers room, so she no longer wakes up when the sun comes up! However the clips that come with it are terrible, they break almost every day when I’m opening the blinds, so it takes longer than it should to open them due to having to constantly pick up the clips from the floor, put them back together, and then try again. Once they’re up they hold the blind up very well, they’re just very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: We used three of these for the front windows in our park model. They are over the existing accordion blinds, which are cream in color. Adding these little babies cut the heat down ten fold. Clips are not much help, but I can improvise especially given the cost; and trying to get these suckers back up are a pain. But I do it every morning and it really only takes me a few minutes. If you're looking a cheap alternative, these are it... and they made my little reading nook look so clean and sleek. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: amydsmith

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Not good for if you ever want to open them. Clips fly off and dont hold up the blinds. Adhesive came loose after less than a month. They do block light but I had to push pin them up and it’s really annoying trying to accordion them up and using clips that won’t hold.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Warning California prop 65
customer_reviews.text: These shades were not bad at all..until i happen to look on the box and saw a California warning...no way im having something hanging in my room that can cause cancer...this should be illegal to sell stuff like this im so disappointed as i did not see the warning in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Torri H

customer_reviews.title: A Good Inexpensive Fix
customer_reviews.text: The blackout curtains in my baby's room were not dark enough, so we ordered these to create more darkness. They do the trick and we close the curtains over the blinds. However, they don't stay up (even with provided clips) so his room has to be dark 24/7. They're also really cheaply made and flimsy, but they do the trick for a quick, inexpensive fix.
customer_reviews.author: B. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great price work well
customer_reviews.text: Great buy item as described used in a rental and worked perfect.. I didn’t use the clips to hold them up so can’t say how well that works but they blocked out enough light and so easy to trim and install. Looking for an affordable window covering you have found it
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive solution to daytime light.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect inexpensive solution for those who work night shifts. I didn’t want to get rid of my blinds but found this was a great alternative that sticks directly to the window underneath my blinds. During the day I keep it pinned up so light can pass through. Needed to trim the sides when I purchased but it’s fairy easy with a blade or a pair of scissors.
customer_reviews.author: Keshia

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to heavy curtains and expensive custom blinds.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for a cheap effective solution to block light without having to buy heavy curtains or expensive custom blinds. WAY better than those paper black out shades. I tried those. These shades are easy to trim and fit. Just stick in place and they actually do stay stuck. Unlike the paper ones these actually have a cord that you use to draw the shades. No trying to fold and use clips to secure. Just pull drawstring and you're done.
customer_reviews.author: FRGII

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang For Your 13 Bucks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a west facing window that gets the harsh afternoon Texas sun. Was a little difficult to trim, since I didn't have the proper tools, but managed to get it done!. I keep it down all the time, and it has stayed in place and makes a huge difference in helping keep my living room cool. For less than $13 dollars, it's a deal!
customer_reviews.author: P. Antwerp

customer_reviews.title: Super dark!
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Very opaque and works well in our nursery (though it is a North facing window, I think it would work well even in a brighter room). Kind of a pain to scrunch up in order to open it, but since cords are dangerous and other cordless shades are much more expensive, I can't really complain.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these to replace vinyl blinds in a shop. The blinds became so dirty and were hard to clean so we tried these shades. They are impossible to raise and lower, the clips supplied to keep them up keep popping off, they can not be raised more than a foot because the clips do not hold the blinds in place because they are too thick at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Bill White

customer_reviews.title: Quick inexpensive solution to west window with hot afternoon sun
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install. Just wipe area clean. Peel strip. Center on window. Press on. At first I didn’t have it quite level across but I was able to lift and re press. Add clips to keep shade open or drop down to close. Bottom has a weighted bar. Not really room darkening as light still filters through. Thin plastic vs honeycomb style I had previously. 36” barely covered my window and light comes in around each edge. Seems tear resistant. Overall satisfied with price and quality
customer_reviews.author: Judy Krause

customer_reviews.title: Ease of installation
customer_reviews.text: I love these shades! Nice and clean look with no hardware. Super easy to install and definitely darkens a room. - moved into a new apt and the sun rise was a killer! This morning was nice and cozy in my cave. 😜 I've read they have lasted for up to 3 years. Even if they don't at this price - who cares. Only negative comment - I had to buy the shades (8 of them) with the clips. Which was fine - except for the fact that 2 of the clips needed to be fixed so I could use them. They arent too sturdy and already looked to see if they sell replacement clips.
customer_reviews.author: SB0918

customer_reviews.title: Room is definitely darker!
customer_reviews.text: I gave 4 stars cause they are quite flimsy. However, i put them up in my 2 yr old daughter's room and we probably won't mess with them much. I plan to buy more for my bedroom where they will be moved up and down...so I'm hoping they'll hold up. But the sticky part has held them up for the 3 weeks I've had them. They were very easy to put up...they are literally big stickers. And they do their job :) I'm happy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: teacher_z14

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Used them for two windows in my garage to replace some ugly paper blinds. They look better than the paper ones for sure but still look petty cheap. Adhesive is pretty good. A couple spots bubble up everyday and I just push them back down. Overall they are worth the money for a shop or garage, but look pretty cheesy to use as a main blind in your home.
customer_reviews.author: B. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Bargain shades exceed expectations.
customer_reviews.text: These shades do a good job of blocking out light. They are a blessing for those who work nights or odd and need a quick solution to daytime sleeping problems. The mounting tape is surprisingly strong and I don;t foresee any problems with the shades falling. My only complaint is that these Achim brand shades are basically "one size fits all" and they were a little difficult to cut to the correct size I needed. For the price point, I think these are a great bargain.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Will completely block sun, but has some caveats
customer_reviews.text: Installing was quick and easy, it does in fact block out 100% light. But, the fabric is kinda papery. Overnight, it might stretch out a bit and when you try to open and secure them, you'll have to coax them to fold together neatly again.
customer_reviews.author: Nuggets

customer_reviews.title: getting old so sometimes after work I like to take a nap and with this shade it ...
customer_reviews.text: Really darkens my room, getting old so sometimes after work I like to take a nap and with this shade it really helps to practically make the room pitch black. My only advice is to cut the shade maybe 1/8" narrower than the width of the window, you want it tight to block as much light as you can. If too tight you can always recut it to get a tight fit but able to raise and lower the shade.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Anthony Dean

customer_reviews.title: Just What We Needed
customer_reviews.text: These worked great in my camper as we were doing it over and didn't want anything permanently installed until we were done. For the price, they were a great deal and I was sad to see them come down. Am considering buying more once camper is finished and finding a way to install them permanently since they are lightweight and provide great privacy at the pull of a string!
customer_reviews.author: Teeni

customer_reviews.title: Perfect temporary blinds
customer_reviews.text: Best temp blinds! I didn't want to spend $$$ on permanent blinds as we rent right now, so these are a great alternative. I added a couple of tacks at the top so they will stay up longer and I don't have to worry too much about raising and lowering often for fear of the adhesive giving out. Honestly they are way easier to clean than regular blinds and provide more light filter as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time; you'll be returning these...
customer_reviews.text: Description implies shades are easily raised or lowered by combining/releasing pleats. I bought 4, installed 2. after a few days, they are almost impossible to fold back up and the clips that hold the folded pleats together can only hold about half the shade otherwise they will fall off at random times... The corded system was a 5/5; these new cordless ones are just a money grab where they are selling us a folded piece of Vinyl. 0/5.
customer_reviews.author: Adepto

customer_reviews.title: Works until you want to pull the blinds up
customer_reviews.text: First off, cutting these to fit the correct dimensions is an absolute pain. Once up, these blinds work as advertised but become incredibly difficult to clip back up as the material crinkles and bends forcing you to straighten them out at every crease. It's incredibly annoying every time you want to adjust the height.
customer_reviews.author: Claire Zen

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE! TERRIBLE! RETURN COST $20
customer_reviews.text: These are thin and cheap. EXTREMELY hard to roll up. It took my husband 15 minutes to roll them up. They get very wrinkled. Clips don't work. I used food bag clips. I ordered 6 and returned 4. Had to pay return postage which was $20 even though I ordered them through Prime which said free return.
customer_reviews.author: Dran

customer_reviews.title: Cave like darkness when paired with curtains
customer_reviews.text: Actually surprised by how much light it blocks. My husband is a third shifter and we have two windows that face the sun in our bedroom. These blocked out most of the light, but used with our semi-blackout curtains it’s like a cave in there lol.
customer_reviews.author: Halle

customer_reviews.title: Good for money but I’d get a better one
customer_reviews.text: It goes all the way down but won’t stay in place I’d pay a little more and get a good one this one moves around some so it doesn’t block all the light unfortunately. Good price for what this does though. It does block a lot of light just moves so one day it works well and the next it may not. We have air vents on the floor though which may be why were having issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Breezy

customer_reviews.title: Cordless is worthless. Won't send corded version.
customer_reviews.text: So many things wrong with this. 1) stickiness failed after a week 2) the cordless is impossible to fold up without two people 3) even if you do get it collapsed the clips provided don't hold it 4) I ordered a CORDED blind hoping it would work better, they sent me a garbage cordless one in white, when I ordered black. I returned asking for replacement and they sent me black this time but STILL CORDLESS! only good thing I can say is I got a full refund
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Barta

customer_reviews.title: Used the shades as vertical blinds
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved into an apartment with a very big (over 100 inches wide) window and had this idea as a way to block the sun in the late afternoon which can really be overwhelming at times. I installed snaps at the top, bottom and center of the leading edge, mounted the shades on a very thin piece of wood (painted white) and used velcro to attach it to the window jamb. I also installed snaps on straps attached to the wood support to hold the shades in place when not in use. I think the project came out quite well, and the quality of the product help me succeed.
customer_reviews.author: ConCris

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought an older 60s rennovated home with HUGE custom windows, i didnt have the budget for real shades but the glare on the tv was terrible so i decided to try these out. Im really happy with them, they were really easy to install and they work great. I decided i need 4 more for the top windows so i ordered more. For the price i would say they are definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alesha Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Significant difference noticed
customer_reviews.text: These made our room significantly darker. Definitely not 100% (i say that for the moms trying to completely block out all light) BUT it'll get you 85% of the way there. The light seeps in from the sides, but maybe with some tape or additional dark curtains, you could achieve it
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Blackout room well!
customer_reviews.text: These are clearly a cheaper solution however they do work well! Bought for my 1 year old daughters room because blinds and curtains didn’t darken enough and she immediately slept in later in the am when we installed them! Only been up a few days so not sure how long they will last but easy and quick solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jamiefay

customer_reviews.title: Heats up the room
customer_reviews.text: My kitchen window is east facing and gets a lot of sun. It's especially unbearable in the summer. I got these blinds in the hopes of cooling down my kitchen but it's made of some kind of plastic and being black it absorbs all the heat and radiates it into the kitchen. After having it installed for 1 day, as soon as I would enter the kitchen, this intense heat would hit my body. I took it down after 2 day of use. Although, very effective for darkening the room, would not recommend for small rooms like kitchens.
customer_reviews.author: Sachin Kumar

customer_reviews.title: these were much needed and I couldn't be more pleased. They look just like some much more expensive ...
customer_reviews.text: With the heat pouring through the two windows I ordered these for; these were much needed and I couldn't be more pleased. They look just like some much more expensive blinds I had in the past, and took all of 5 minutes to put up. Love the string adjustment also. So much easier and neater than the clips I had on a previous temporary shade. Recommended, would order again.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kay

customer_reviews.title: That’s a good thing though
customer_reviews.text: Very, very sticky adhesive. Make sure that you don’t accidentally let it stick while you’re still lining things up. I got lucky that mine grabbed right where I wanted it. That’s a good thing though, I’d rather it be extra sticky than not. For the price, there’s no reason to buy anything else for a quick application. Definitely darkens the room great.
customer_reviews.author: Rei

customer_reviews.title: Buy! You won't regret !
customer_reviews.text: I am so much in love with this vinyl window shade that I bought (3) of them. They are quite durable & after a year I found a tear in my livingroom side window shade. I began to panic that I was not going to remember where I had bought them from. I searched all the local large stores in neighorhood, then remembered I bought them on-line. The stores only offered the shades that had to be nailed into window frame (ugh) Simple,easy,neat,beautiful,durable,easy to use, is only a few words to describe the quality of these blinds. Nothing else come close to this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. M

customer_reviews.title: Blackout sunshne!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for where I use it under mini blind totally keeps sun out! And if like last one it lasted couple years atleast of opening & closing every day. Update strings came out of little button, this could have been my fault for not leaving them foot or more longer then u think! But not sure . Still works for now I just tie strings in bow to keep raised but not happy about this!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty amazing for the price and easy enough to install ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I bought these, since they worked so fantastically well the first go around. They lasted 3 years (first purchased March 2013) before the sun started degrading the vinyl. Pretty amazing for the price and easy enough to install if you have strong scissors. The second go around though, the adhesive used to adhere the vinyl blind to the pull down plastic section is not as strong and the vinyl started detaching days afterwards. I keep trying to stick it back to the plastic but it pops off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kid's room
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to leave an honest review on these blinds. I bought 2 of these after reading many reviews. I put a set in each of my child's bedroom so they'd sleep a little better. They make my kid's room completely black. I love it! I honestly wouldn't have them hanging in my main living room because they are not much to look at but in my kid's room they are hidden behind curtains. They serve thier purpose very well.
customer_reviews.author: Anjie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These definitely block out light and help with keeping the room cooler. Can’t say the are total black out, but I am pleased with this product! Bought 5 of these. For many small windows. Easy to cut with my plant scissors.
customer_reviews.author: DEZ G

customer_reviews.title: A simple to attach shade
customer_reviews.text: When a no-cord venetian blind I bought simply was to translucent, I purchased this shade as a temporary measure to reduce sunlight. It is however to tedious to stretch up and down on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Archimedes

customer_reviews.title: Hmm...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't very happy when I got these (bought 3) and found out they are a peel and stick shade. They are very easy to install but flimsy as crap and they crinkle very easy making it annoying to raise the blinds up. I've only had them up for a week so I'm not sure how they are going to hold up as far as the stickiness of the double sided tape.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley D.

customer_reviews.title: Leave Them Down
customer_reviews.text: Blackout - Yes. Easy to install - Yes. Functionality - Poor. I have three of these in my bedroom. Opening and closing these are a pain. They do not properly fold up. They do not stay up unless you clip them with something. I use a binder clip.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at blacking out - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use, but be careful to measure twice! If you cut them too short at all, you can have a small gap of light..... which is super noticeable because of how well these block out the majority of the light. The clasp at the bottom has been easy to open and adjust, but we usually leave them down so I haven't tried if much. We would get these again for other rooms because they are so straightforward, but we will be more careful when cutting them to size!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good shades with strong adhesion
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shades after viewing many other products of a similar kind. Other sellers were selling in 2 pack, 6 pack, however, I only need one and a good one. I bought this one out of necessity as my landlord did not provide blinds for my room. The shades were a bit wider than my window, so I had to cut approx 2.5 inches and stick it. The installation was pretty straight forward. This is my first-day review. If I had any problems, I will update the review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I imagined
customer_reviews.text: Great temporary item for some one moving to a new home. When you don't want to hang sheets in the windows these work great. If you have narrow windows you can cut the shade and possibly cover more than one window with one shade. You will need a good sharp knife, pair of scissors, box cutter or similar item to cut the shade if it needs to be trimmed. The adhesion is really good. Maybe a little better than it needs to be. When you remove the shades there is a lot of the glue on the surface that you hung the shade from.
customer_reviews.author: YVONNE

customer_reviews.title: Plan on buying these for my whole house!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these in hopes to make our kitchen not so gloomy and it lives up to my expectations and then some! Also, it blocks out a lot of light. I ordered double sided tape to hang them up just to play it safe so I couldn't tell you how the adhesive alone works. Plus, the quality of these shades for the price is superb! I plan on buying these for the rest of the windows that dont have shades in our house!
customer_reviews.author: Tia Perez

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got these to block out the light in my baby's room that the vertical blinds let through. He wasn't able to settle down for naps during the day time until these went up! They work perfectly! Been up for months now with no issues. We did wipe down the area we were going to adhere these blinds to with rubbing alcohol before putting up to clean up any residue first, which I think helped.
customer_reviews.author: K. Publy

customer_reviews.title: Good for temporary use, not worth $12 compared to ikea one ($2.99)
customer_reviews.text: I would say it's a bit better quality than my previous one from ikea, which was only $2.99 Good for temporary use only. came with two clips Is it really worth $12? I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cho

customer_reviews.title: This is the best temporary shade bar none
customer_reviews.text: These blinds are becoming increasingly difficult to find. The quality of the product, the durability and the aggressive glue used to adhere the product is the best. I think they are discontinuing this product and it is regrettable, because the cordless blinds are inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Livwell

customer_reviews.title: Tired of Daytime?
customer_reviews.text: I worked second shift for a long time and often found myself going to sleep as the sun came up, especially in the warmer months. This drove me crazy and made my already bad sleeping situation worse. I bought these and had them up in minutes and they block out 99% of the light. Now that I'm back on first shift, I can sleep all the way through the entire weekend without seeing that pesky sun.
customer_reviews.author: Locked Lamora

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one exception...
customer_reviews.text: Great product with one exception, I have to deduct one star for the description failing to mention that this product is NOT white (as it appears in the picture). It's actually a smokey blue gray. I'm sure that would make a huge difference for many. Previously I owned a white one in another brand that lasted about 4 years. From the looks of it, I can safely say I'd expect the same or better from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mone

customer_reviews.title: Black out blinds!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived right on time and I have put up 2 out of 6. They did not take long to put up but you had better have a really sharp knife to cut through the blind itself if you need to do so to fit a window like I did. They are great black out windows and I am Siked about doing the rest should be great for shielding the hot sun!
customer_reviews.author: Safirblu

customer_reviews.title: Blocks light very well and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This shade has made me hate my neighbors significantly less now that the super bright porch light they leave on all night isn't shining right into my bedroom while I'm trying to sleep. I kept waking up in the middle of the night thinking it was dawn, but now its darker than dawn even at noon thanks to this shade. My only complaint is that it comes with half as many clips as it needs to keep it all they way up, but I bought some chip clips from the grocery store to use in addition to the original clips and they made it work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

product_meta.title: Achim Home Furnishings 123CO36B24 Cordless 1-2-3, 36" x 75", Black Vinyl Room Darkening Pleated Window Shade
product_meta.description: Style:New Cordless!| Size:36" x 75"| Color:BlackThe Cordless 1-2-3 Peel ‘N Stick Room Darkening Vinyl Shade is designed for those who want a quick and easy solution to their window covering needs. The cordless shade is an easy, pleated, peel and stick alternative to a traditional window shade. Setup is simple as 1, 2, 3: 1. Size it perfectly for your window by trimming down to any width with a utility knife. 2. Installs quickly without the use of any tools; simply peel and stick. 3. Adjust the shade’s position by using the included clips to gather or release the pleats. Each shade is made of durable, textured vinyl with a PVC bottom rail that prevents sagging. Shade width can be trimmed down to any size; length of shade is 75 inches. Easy to clean too: simply wipe or dust with a cloth.
feature_bullets: The cordless 1-2-3 Peel ‘N Stick Room Darkening VINYL Shade is designed for those who want a quick and easy solution to their window covering needs.
The cordless 123 room darkening window shade is an easy, pleated, peel and stick alternative to a traditional window paper shade.
Each pleated window shade is made of durable, textured vinyl with a PVC BOTTOM RAIL TO PREVENT SAGGING.
Temporary window shade width can be trimmed down to any size; length of shade is 75 inches.

Setup is simple as 1, 2, 3: 1. Size it perfectly for your window by trimming down to any width with a utility knife. 2. Installs quickly without the use of any tools; simply peel and stick. 3. Adjust the shade’s position by using the included clips to gather or release the pleats.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,370 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
